questions.description: Three charges 2q, –q, –q are located at the vertices of an equilateral triangle. At the centre of the triangle-

options.description: the field is zero but potential is non-zero
the field is non-zero but potential is zero
both field and potential are zero

questions.description:
Assertion : If a positive charge is released it moves from higher potential to lower potential. 
Reason : Force on positive charge is along 
 Ē, which is from high potential to low potential.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

Consider the following statements and choose the correct option –
(A)The potential of a charged conductor throughout its volume is same.
(B)The line integral of electric field is zero along any path in electrostatic conductor.

options.description: Both A and B are correct
Both A and B are incorrect
A is correct but B is incorrect
A is incorrect but B is correct

questions.description:
Assertion : Electric field lines are perpendicular to the surface of conductor.
Reason : Surfaces of conductor are equipotential.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

options.description: concentric cylinders with axis as x–axis

Assertion : Gauss’s law can not be used to calculate electric field near an electric dipole. 
Reason : Electric dipoles do not have symmetrical charge distribution.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: An electric dipole is placed inside a homogeneous electric field increasing at the rate of α per unit distance along z-axis. The dipole undergoes  -

options.description: may a rotational motion and a translational motion along z-axis

questions.description: Electrostatic field is zero ___ the charged conductor.

Assertion : Two adjacent conductors carrying the same charge can be at different potentials.
Reason : The conductors may have different size and hence different capacitances.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: When two charged conductor are brought into contact the electric charge on them is shared.

Assertion : When charges are shared between two parallel plate capacitors, charge of system is conserved but some energy is lost.
Reason : During the sharing of charges, some energy is dissipated as heat.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: A 20F capacitor is charged to 5V and lsolated. It is then connected in parallel with an uncharged 30F capacitor. The energy loss will be-

Statement-I : A parallel plate capacitor is connected across a battery through a key. A dielectric slab of dielectric constant K is introduced between the plates. The energy which is stored becomes K times.
Statement-II : The potential difference between the plates of capacitor, connected to battery remains constant or unchanged.

options.description: Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct.
Both Statement-I and Statement-II are incorrect.
Statement-I is correct but Statement-II is incorrect.
Statement-I is incorrect but Statement-II is correct.
